content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Given a DataFrame df_cars with column `model`, write a function `count_model_rows` that groups data by model and calculate how many rows there are for each.

To achieve this in Julia, you can use the following code:

```julia
using DataFrames

function count_model_rows(df_cars::DataFrame)
    counts = groupby(df_cars, :model) do g
        length(g)
    end

    return counts
end
```

This function takes a `DataFrame` called `df_cars` as an input parameter and groups the data by the `model` column. It then calculates the length of each group (i.e., how many rows are there for each model) using the `groupby` function from the DataFrames package.

To use this function, simply call it with your `df_cars` DataFrame as an argument:

```julia
df_counts = count_model_rows(df_cars)
```

The resulting `df_counts` will be a new DataFrame containing the grouped data and the corresponding row counts for each model.
